messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Herbal ritual book
messages.msgSnippet: well, as i said, our honey isn t even done yet, but i started dipping into the pot and spooning it to our son, who s colds usually last for at least a week,
messages.messageBody:
well, as i said, our honey isn't even done yet, but i started dipping into the
pot and spooning it to our son, who's colds usually last for at least a week,
and he's better already this morning, after only one day. (cold cure or no,
it's sure delicious.)

Julie Stauffer wrote:

> <<how much thyme honey did you use>>
>
> Actually, we never took it to "ward off" a cold. I simply used it a lot in
> cooking. Throw some in a soup, the bean pot, stew. Slather it on toast.
> That kind of thing. No colds was just a benefit.
>
> Julie
>

messages.subject: Re: Herbal ritual book
messages.msgSnippet: Actually, we never took it to ward off a cold.  I simply used it a lot in cooking.  Throw some in a soup, the bean pot,
messages.messageBody:
<<how much thyme honey did you use>>

Actually, we never took it to "ward off" a cold. I simply used it a lot in
cooking. Throw some in a soup, the bean pot, stew. Slather it on toast.
That kind of thing. No colds was just a benefit.

Julie
